availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, farmer. South Carolina native. Married Allice Edith Stinnett in Todd County in September 1832. Father of Henry Armstrong, Francis Armstrong, Harvey Armstrong, Virginia Armstrong, Wilson Armstrong, Margaret Armstrong, Martha Armstrong, A. H. Armstrong, Paralee Armstrong, Sarah Armstrong, and Loving Armstrong. Married Jennetta J. Berry in Todd County in March 1854. Farmer in Todd County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Todd County in 1850. Farmer in Todd County in 1860. Arrested by Federal authorities on June 7, 1862. Prisoner at Camp Chase, Ohio in August 1862.
